content: धारा {@--1@} A stream or current of water, a line of descending fluid, stream, current; <ls>Bh. 2. 93</ls>; <ls>Me. 55</ls>; <ls>R. 16. 66</ls>; आबद्धधारमश्रु प्रावर्तत <ls>Dk. 74.</ls> {@--2@} A shower, a hard or sharp-driving shower. {@--3@} A continuous line or series; <ls>Bv. 2. 20.</ls> {@--4@} A leak or hole in a pitcher. {@--5@} The pace of a horse; धाराः प्रसाधयितुमव्यतिकीर्णरूपाः <ls>Śi. 5. 60.</ls> {@--6@} The margin, edge or border of anything; ध्रुवं स नीलोत्पलपत्रधारया शमीलतां छेत्तुमृषिर्व्यबस्यति <ls>Ś. 1. 18.</ls> {@--7@} The sharp edge of a sword, axe, or of any cutting instrument; तर्जितः परशुधारया मम <ls>R. 11. 78</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 42</ls>; <ls n="R.">10. 86</ls>, <ls n="R. 10.">41</ls>; <ls>Bh. 2. 28.</ls> {@--8@} The edge of a mountain or precipice. {@--9@} A wheel or the periphery of a wheel; <ls>R. 13. 15.</ls> {@--10@} A garden-wall, fence, hedge. {@--11@} The van or front line of an army. {@--12@} The highest point, excellence {@--13@} A multitude. {@--14@} Fame. {@--15@} Night. {@--16@} Turmeric. {@--17@} Likeness. {@--18@} The tip of the ear. {@--19@} Speech. {@--20@} Rumour, report.
